abstracts.cdata!:
This is environmental assessment for the
            Benin Poverty Reduction Support Credit Project, which
            strengthens the Government's capacity to design and
            carry out its development and poverty reduction programs.
            analyses potential environmental and social impacts. Key
            safeguard issues are mainly related to the drilling of wells
            for the rural water supply, and medical waste generation and
            handling. Such impacts are expected to be modest and
            reversible through mitigation measures. Activities related
            to forests and adjacent lands management are part of broader
            programs spanning a five-year period, although those
            activities planned for this project do not appear to
            generate any adverse environmental impacts. Hence the
            environmental and social management plan for PRSC-2 will
            include appropriate guidance aimed at mitigating expected
            negative impacts. Sector-specific measures aimed at
            mitigating negative impacts forPRSC-1 include the following:
            To protect the water supply, complete a mandatory impact
            assessment for the dam; avoid unsanitary sites (cemeteries,
            cattle pens, etc); control wastewater and mud around wells;
            sensitize users about hygiene; and impose restrictions on
            the distance between well and latrines. To manage medical
            wastes, train personnel, acquire health care equipment and
            use incinerators. To reduce impacts surrounding urban
            sanitation, help update the 1998 master sanitation plan by
            selecting high priority low-income areas where urgent
            improvement of sanitation services is needed in order to
            reduce the burden of environment-related diseases. However
            investments in earthworks and dam construction will not
            start until 2005.
